flawed_nl_solution:
For 6 months of the year he cuts his yard 15 days per month so he cuts his yard 6*15 = <<6*15=90>>90 times
For the remaining 6 months of the year, he cuts his yard 3 times a month so he cuts his yard 6*3 = <<6*3=18>>18 times
He cuts his yard 90 times for part of the year and 18 times for the rest of the year for a total of 90+18 = <<90+18=180>>180 times
There are 12 months in a year and he cuts his yard 180 times so he averages 180/12 = <<180/12=15>>15 times per month
#### 15

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 108, not 180. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
